abstracts.cdata!:
The resettlement plan for the Xinxiang -
            Zhengzhou highway upgrade of the National Highway
            (Hebei-Henan) Project, calls for actions to compensate
            affected populations for loss of land, standing crops, and
            resettlement. In the case of acquisition of sub-urban
            vegetable plots, State regulations require payment from the
            project unit. Compensation fees for cultivated land should
            be based on an estimated annual production value, per an
            average three year period, prior to acquisition, and,
            resettlement grants should at least, maintain the living
            standards of the affected population. Likewise, affected
            collective units must use land compensation, and
            resettlement grants to develop production, and/or create
            jobs, for vulnerable groups. The county land administration
            department, in coordination with the project owner and the
            affected populations, should engage in an effort to provide
            labor, through agricultural production, and township
            enterprise development, under strict land control for
            township construction. In consultation with the affected
            population, the following are avenues of participation in
            the resettlement process: 1) selection of specific
            residential sites for housing locations; 2) choice for
            affected people to either build their own houses, or select
            government built houses; 3) ability to elect employment
            opportunities; and, 4) grievance mechanisms will be
            available, during resettlement implementation.
